# grayWorldDeviceWhiteBalanceGains

**Instance Property**

The current device-specific white balance values required for a neutral gray white point.

## Declaration

```swift
var grayWorldDeviceWhiteBalanceGains: AVCaptureDevice.WhiteBalanceGains { get }
```

## Discussion

This property specifies the current red, green, and blue gain values derived from the current scene to deliver a neutral (or gray world) white point for white balance.

Gray world values assume you’ve placed a neutral subject (for example, a gray card) in the middle of the subject area, and fills the center 50% of the frame. Apps can read these values and apply them to the device using [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/setWhiteBalanceModeLocked(with:completionHandler:)].

Each change supports values between `1.0` and [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/maxWhiteBalanceGain]. You can read the value at any time, regardless of white balance mode.

This property is key-value observable.

## Inspecting gain levels

- **deviceWhiteBalanceGains**: The current device-specific RGB white balance gain values in use.
- **maxWhiteBalanceGain**: The maximum supported value to which you can set a color channel.
